      • getResourceBody

        public byte[] getResourceBody(org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentResource resource)
                       throws org.sakaiproject.exception.ServerOverloadException
        Read the resource's body.
        Specified by:
        getResourceBody in interface BaseContentService.Storage
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource whose body is desired.
        Returns:
        The resources's body content as a byte array.
        Throws:
        org.sakaiproject.exception.ServerOverloadException - if the server is configured to save the resource body in the filesystem and an error occurs while accessing the server's filesystem, or if the server is configured to save the resource body in the database, and the resource cannot be read back from the database.

      • getResourceBodyDb

        protected byte[] getResourceBodyDb(org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentResource resource)
                            throws org.sakaiproject.exception.ServerOverloadException
        Read the resource's body from the database.
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource whose body is desired.
        Returns:
        The resources's body content as a byte array.
        Throws:
        org.sakaiproject.exception.ServerOverloadException - if the resource cannot be read from the database because its length exceeds 2G.

      • getResourceBodyFilesystem

        protected byte[] getResourceBodyFilesystem(org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentResource resource)
                                    throws org.sakaiproject.exception.ServerOverloadException
        Read the resource's body from the external file system.
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource whose body is desired.
        Returns:
        The resources's body content as a byte array.
        Throws:
        org.sakaiproject.exception.ServerOverloadException - if server is configured to store resource body in filesystem and error occurs trying to read from filesystem.

        Description copied from interface: BaseContentService.Storage
        Stream the resource's body.
        Specified by:

        Throws:
        org.sakaiproject.exception.ServerOverloadException - if server is configured to save resource body in filesystem and an error occurs while trying to access the filesystem.

      • streamResourceBodyFilesystem

        protected InputStream streamResourceBodyFilesystem(org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentResource resource)
                                            throws org.sakaiproject.exception.ServerOverloadException
        Return an input stream.
        Parameters:
        resource - - the resource for the stream It is a non-fatal error for the file not to be readible as long as the resource's expected length is zero. We check for the body length *after* we try to read the file. If the file is readible, we simply read it and return it as the body.
        Throws:
        org.sakaiproject.exception.ServerOverloadException

      • streamResourceBodyDb

        protected InputStream streamResourceBodyDb(org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentResource resource)
                                    throws org.sakaiproject.exception.ServerOverloadException
        When resources are stored, zero length bodys are not placed in the table hence this routine will return a null when the particular resource body is not found
        Throws:
        org.sakaiproject.exception.ServerOverloadException

      • putResourceBodyDb

        protected boolean putResourceBodyDb(org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentResourceEdit resource,
                        byte[] body)
        Write the resource body to the database table.
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource whose body is being written.
        body - The body bytes to write. If there is no body or the body is zero bytes, no entry is inserted into the table.
        Returns:
        true if the resource body is written successfully, false otherwise.

      • putResourceBodyDb

                        InputStream stream)
        Parameters:
        edit -
        stream -
        Returns:
        true if the resource body is written successfully, false otherwise.

      • putResourceBodyFilesystem

        protected boolean putResourceBodyFilesystem(org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentResourceEdit resource,
                                byte[] body)
        Write the resource body to the external file system. The file name is the m_bodyPath with the resource id appended.
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource whose body is being written.
        body - The body bytes to write. If there is no body or the body is zero bytes, no entry is inserted into the filesystem.
        Returns:
        true if the resource body is written successfully, false otherwise.

        Parameters:

      • getMemberCount

        public int getMemberCount(String collectionId)
        Description copied from interface: BaseContentService.Storage
        Get a count of all members of a collection, where 'member' means the collection is the immediate parent of the item. The count is not recursive and it will include all resources and collections whose immediate parent is the collection identified by the parameter.
        Specified by:
        getMemberCount in interface BaseContentService.Storage

      • getResourcesOfType

        public Collection<org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentResource> getResourcesOfType(String resourceType,
                                                                          int pageSize,
                                                                          int page)
        Description copied from interface: BaseContentService.Storage
        Retrieve a collection of ContentResource objects pf a particular resource-type. The collection will contain no more than the number of items specified as the pageSize, where pageSize is a non-negative number less than or equal to 1028. The resources will be selected in ascending order by resource-id. If the resources of the specified resource-type in the ContentHostingService in ascending order by resource-id are indexed from 0 to M and this method is called with parameters of N for pageSize and I for page, the resources returned will be those with indexes (I*N) through ((I+1)*N - 1). For example, if pageSize is 1028 and page is 0, the resources would be those with indexes of 0 to 1027.
        Specified by:
        getResourcesOfType in interface BaseContentService.Storage
        Parameters:
        resourceType - select resources where CONTENT_RESOURCE.RESOURCE_TYPE_ID equals resourceType
        pageSize - (page) size of results
        page - (page) increment of results
        Returns:
        collection of ContentResource

      • getContextResourcesOfType

        public Collection<org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentResource> getContextResourcesOfType(String resourceType,
                                                                                 Set<String> contextIds)
        Description copied from interface: BaseContentService.Storage
        Retrieve a collection of ContentResource objects of a particular resource-type in a set of contexts.
        Specified by:
        getContextResourcesOfType in interface BaseContentService.Storage
        Parameters:
        resourceType - select resources where CONTENT_RESOURCE.RESOURCE_TYPE_ID equals resourceType
        contextIds - select resources where CONTENT_RESOURCE.CONTEXT in [context,...]
        Returns:
        collection of ContentResource
